result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary A. Link was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: All Financial obligations shall be paid to the Clerk of Courts within 60 days unless a payment plan is established.
Shall undergo and follow through with any counseling as directed by agent

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Dodge Cty DNA Proof of Submission

Plea/sentencing hearing on November 23, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Jury trial on December 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Called 16TR2145, 16TR2146,16CF238 and 15CF315. Defendant Zachary A. Link in court with attorney William Henry Gergen.  Attorney James Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court heard regarding calling the 15CF315 case - an adjournment was requested back in May 2015. Atty Sempf heard, in the mean time the Def. picked up another case. Atty Gergen heard, has a global resolution, heard regarding Def. competency, Def. having difficulty this morning requests short adjournment of 30 days, can not get through PQ with Def. in appropriate manner, heard further on psych. evaluations, requests adjournment again. Atty Sempf heard, will not object to request. Atty Gergen  heard. Court heard, will adjoun one more time.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 23, 2016 at 11:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for December 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Zachary A. Link in court with attorney William Henry Gergen.  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Review of info is waived; not guilty plea entered; 10 days mtns; stc set; bail con't

(8:23) Defendant Zachary A. Link in court with attorney William Henry Gergen.  Kurt Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Def.'s mother is also present; This is competency hearing; Court has rec'd Dr. Schoenecker's report, reviewed by all parties; Atty. Gergen does not object to a finding of competence; State concurs; Court enters finding of competency; PH time limits set; PH set 3/31/16 at 8:30am in Br. 2; bond cont.
from OCRP director Dr. Lundbohm re: def not appropriate of program

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: 8:35. Defendant, Zachary A. Link, in court with Attorney William Henry Gergen.  Attorney James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions Deft.  Court questions Atty Sempf.  Exhibit list. Court finds that Deft is NOT competent to proceed at this time, will suspend proceedings at this time, refers Deft to DHS for treatment.  Atty Sempf heard.
No contact with victim and residence removed

Defendant Zachary A. Link in court with attorney William Henry Gergen.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Sempf states that there is victim rights compliance, victim is here, State is not taking a position on the motion.  Atty. Gergen is heard on his motion, requesting conditions 1 and 3 be deleted.  Victim is heard.  Atty. Sempf still takes no position.  Court is head, Court allows contact, no violent/abusive contact remains, also be allowed to return to residence.

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with alleged victim, B.K.L., dob 11/18/64 or her residence.   Defendant shall not go on the premises at W10479 Ghost Hill Road, Columbus WI, except Defendant may go to the residence at issue one time in the company of a uniformed law enforcement officer to retrieve his/her personal property.  Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Defendant shall not possess any firearms.

(12:57) Defendant Zachary A. Link in custody via video with attorney Jaclyn R. Shelton (jail only).  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Shelton raises issue of comptency, heard further; Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Court orders Def. referred for competency evaluation; State heard on bond; Court sets $1,000 PA Bond with conditions:  Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with alleged victim, B.K.L., dob 11/18/64 or her residence.  Defendant shall not go on the premises at N10479 Ghost Hill Road, Columbus, WI, except Defendant may go to the residence at issue one time in the company of a uniformed law enforcement officer to retrieve his/her personal property.  Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Defendant shall not possess any firearms.  Competency Hearing to be set
